contents.title: Preparing a study
contents.description: When we are preparing a study there are various things we want to be aware of.

contents.title: Initiating a study
contents.description: The first step in preparing a study is initialising it, where we get all the organisational stuff done.

options.text: The study design is always discussed among lab members and local colleagues.
The design is discussed with other experts on the field using expert consensus method, adversarial collaboration, presubmission inquiry, or registered report.

contents.title: Preregistration
options: We don't do that sort of thing here.

options.text: We publically preregister every project before following \1 standards. At minimum we preregister using \2.

templateOptions.hint: The Open Science Framework offers a variety of preregistration options.
Use this one if you are registering a completed project with data or materials.
This is our standard, comprehensive, and general purpose preregistration form.
AsPredicted offers eight simple questions to support quick preregistration.

options.text: We publicly preregister every confirmatory as well as exploratory project before any data collection following standards, like OSF preregistration challenge.
